text: we're flying at the moment about 10,000
feet above sea level in international
airspace between Indonesia Thailand and
Malaysia this is the area where possibly
as many as 8,000 migrants from Myanmar
also possibly from Bangladesh have been
spotted in various locations our
colleagues have seen them off the coast
of Thailand we know some have come
ashore in Indonesia if we look at the
map this is a stretch of see that runs
between Indonesian Sumatra there
Thailand Malaysia and to the north just
off this map is MIA man that's where
they come from so we knew that they'd
come down in this direction they'd hit
the coastline in Thailand some of them
have come across to Indonesia there's
such a vast body of water out there it's
almost impossible to find out where they
are the precise figures aren't known but
we know that hundreds have made it to
shore and they've come ashore with tales
of deprivation and desperation out and
see maybe short of boo they've been
short of water fights have broken out
were being told of some have literally
jumped overboard and swam ashore when
they've seen sight of land but many of
them are not able to land an F because
of a change of policy by the
government's by the Navy's and of the
government's in the surrounding areas
Indonesian military for example they
said it will not allow these boats to
come ashore if they're in distress and
they will help them the local fishermen
are saying they've been told not to
any kind of assistance at all Malaysia
and Thailand also seem to have very
similar policies can you imagine the
desperation involved in been willing to
put your children onto one of these
rickety old boats in search of something
a little better and unless the policy
changes unless a hand ringing stops the
reality is the hundreds possibly
thousands of migrants will die in those
waters below and nobody will have done
anything about it
